0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (05:15): too much on the latter
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:16): Can't say no to http://i.imgur.com/eqTIb.jpg
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:18): heh, oh wow, I've left so many js projects unfinished, I should probably finish them. :O
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:18): I've been afk from some stuff for too long
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (05:18): no gameboy dev going on?
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:18): Like how there's 2000 lines of 6502 opcode decoding and yet the video code isn't connected to the opcode decoding.
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:18): gameboy color is done
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:18): GBA was being brought up again
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:19): heh, I left myself comments on filling in remaining undocumented opcode handling though. :/
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:19): Since I manually inline everything, so it's spaghetti code for performance in firefox. :(

6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:21): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: Saw the ARM7TDMI emulation core file I left myself, totally in the process of redoing it, since the opcode decoding was too complex for fast decoding without dispatch tables via arrays. :(
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:22): Similar to the GBC emulator, but the opcode funcs array is dynamically built now
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:23): Reading up on stuff like http://members.chello.nl/taf.offenga/illopc31.txt to finish out the undocumented opcode handling verification
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:23): for the NES CPU emulation
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:23): I know JSNES + most NES emulators don't do undocumented opcode handling because the info is limited
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:24): a few of the undocumented opcodes are unreliable, as they differed between factory production runs
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:24): like C64 vs Ricoh's custom
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:25): most are stable, i.e. predictable
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:25): and some simply are illegal - a.k.a. "This kills the CPU"
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:26): due to the way the PLA lines are done in the 6502
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:26): (6502 is NOT microcoded)
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:28): Heh, here's some of the NES code: http://pastebin.com/puHAP8db
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:29): it's kinda all over the place in other files
6a8ca7ce228632a45b077b5398962bf2 (05:29): but the opcode stuff is there
34b0d246331696992e9ee7235f88ca66 (05:31): ok this looks like a chrome bug and I have no idea wtf is going on
34b0d246331696992e9ee7235f88ca66 (05:32): the css and the html need to be in seperate files
34b0d246331696992e9ee7235f88ca66 (05:33): when I load that div class="item" id="shadow"> breaks its float every few refreshes
34b0d246331696992e9ee7235f88ca66 (05:41): its something to do with using section :(
